page.title: 02Introduction (continued)
page.content: According to the map, although it is chiefly farmland, there is a variety of interesting features: farms, old quarries, old churches, part of a recently opened country park at Vogrie, interesting cottages in the villages of Borthwick Mains and Newlandrig, an historic castle, many sights of historical interest and the old, disused Waverly Railway line. Hidden from the road is the important Borthwick Sand Quarry which supplies a large amount of sand for Lothian Region. Of all the many old, disused lime works in the area only one is still working-Middleton Lime Works. The land is hilly; Crow Law being 802 feet high and Tyne Water threads it's way through the valleys on it's journey to the sea.
